Jonathan Chia Guangrong, Fund Manager at JCG FundLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 27 Sep 2018Firstly, how sure are you that your investment will make money? If you are dealing with stocks, you will need to be correct 100% of the time to make money. May not always be possible. Unless you know a way to make money even when you are wrong in your investments (which is possible if you know how. I do it very often). That said, secondly, it's not wise to borrow money to pump into investments. Thirdly, borrowing from too many banks at the same time may drastically affect your credit score and affect your ability to borrow in future. Not a good thing. If you are going to borrow from credit agencies aka legalised loan sharks that's even worse. Their rates are far worse as compared to loans from banks.. Best to think hard before you start borrowing to put into any investment.. Do let us know if you need further help, and all the best 0 comments0

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 26 Sep 2018I don't think it's wise to take up a loan to start investing.
